title: Reg Baker
text:
Arthur Reginald Baker (18 September 1899 – 1 September 1977) was an <a href="Australian%20rules%20football">Australian rules football</a>er who played with <a href="Collingwood%20Football%20Club">Collingwood</a> and <a href="Richmond%20Football%20Club">Richmond</a> in the <a href="Australian%20Football%20League">Victorian Football League</a> (VFL).
VFL career.
One of three brothers to play in the VFL (along with <a href="Selwyn%20Baker">Selwyn</a> and <a href="Ted%20Baker%20%28footballer%29">Ted</a>), Baker played his football as a rover and in the forward line. Baker was a losing grand finalist for Collingwood in both 1925 and 1926. He finished equal fifth in the 1926 <a href="Brownlow%20Medal">Brownlow Medal</a>. 
In 1927, Baker returned to Wonthaggi FC and was captain-coach of their Central Gippsland Football League. 
Baker returned to Collingwood in 1928 and during the <a href="1928%20VFL%20season">1928 VFL season</a>, Baker crossed to Richmond, where he made 10 appearances.
Coaching.
Baker coached his original club Wonthaggi for five years and steered them to three premierships in 1927, 1929 and ? He won a further three premierships as coach of <a href="Leongatha%20Football%20Club">Leongatha</a> in 1931, 1934 and 1935. Baker also spent time as coach of Wonthaggi (1941) Morwell (1947) and Yallourn (1951).
